page.title: 14ECOLOGY
page.content: {ECOLOGY.}Old footpaths cross all the farmland.To make sure the farmers don't plough them people walk them to keep them open.In wild areas of Coggeshall are some rare flowers, like early purple orchids, ox-lips and cow-slips.Unfortunately people sometimes destroy these plants. Fortunately conservationists such as the Coggeshall Society try to prevent this.Water is polluted if rubbish is thrown into it.Animals and plants can then be killed.Farmers put chemicals and fertilizers on their land. Conservationists try to stop pollution going into the rivers and streams to safeguard animals and plants.Stubble burning after harvesting can cause accidents and is very unpleasant. Ripping out hedges causes erosion and snow drifts.The climate is dry and sunny but with cold east winds.
